name: The Conjunction
entries: When the elves arrived, surviving human mages fled to secret abbeys, known as Circles, to continue their craft and worship of Miira undisturbed. After the empire, the abbeys came out of hiding and created the Conjunction, a loose organization led by the strongest archmages who train, study and teach undisturbed by the outside world. Only the most talented spellcasters are invited to train among the Conjunction.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

name: Scarlet Delegate
entries: Based out of Taj’aruhn in Karaj, the Scarlet Delegate is powerful, multinational, monopolistic trading company. Newly established by a group of extremely powerful merchants, the Delegate maintains a tenuous trade agreement between Fairbourne, Karaj, Zemer, and Seneka. It’s commitment to absolute neutrality has turned the Delegate into the only naval organization to have access to both sides of Meridian. As such, the Scarlet Delegate both facilitates and monopolizes open trade between the nations.

The Scarlet Delegate has outposts in each capital city it operates in. Constantly expanding, with dealings in all major trade commodities, the Delegate is careful to follow the individual laws of each nation it deals with. This led to the establishment of the Unbreakable Orders, a set of laws each member must strictly follow. While there is plenty of double dealing, smuggling and other criminal activity, the Delegate’s members must be careful not to get caught.
Faction merchants that endanger the fragile nature of the Delegate’s arrangement, along with their family and friends, are severely punished.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

name: Verdel Den
entries: Hidden deep within Harlan's breach is a town of thieves, brigands and rebel rousers. Dominating Fairec criminal world, the Den is smaller but far more resourceful than their counterparts.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

name: The Lineage
entries: The Rosewhite curse began when the Zeméri Emperor Khyrell Nerisys presented a particularly temperamental fey, Spring Duchess Rosewhite, with a most unflattering portrait. In a rage, Nerisys and his court were trapped in Rosewhite’s portrait for 20 long years. When the fey curse finally ended, Nerisys’ empire had crumbled and what remained lay under siege by a myriad of forces.

In response, the Lineage was born. Non-imperial princes, those born of royal blood but with no claim to the throne, were offered a place as feudal lords, changing the previous political and social structure of Zemér. The new court renounced their princely titles in exchange for territorial privileges, court status, and power not previously accessible to indirect members of the imperial line. They were given new family names, branded beneath their left eye, as a symbol of their status. And with this change, central state power fell into the hands of Nerisys’ loyal blood relatives.

These matriarchically elven houses pass their titles hereditarily, daughter to daughter, and only to full elves. But to prevent lineages from dying out, both illegitimate daughters and family members adopted from collateral family branches (distant cousins) are acceptable heirs. While there is no ban against marrying a human, it does bring notoriety in elven society and all claim to the title is forfeit.

Benefits of being Lineage include seating in the Imperial Court, possession of Imperial relics and garb, a national mourning period after death, the life-long protection of the Trust (military police), the opportunity to marry into the Imperial family, and the most prestigious education in the nation.

After the direct Lineage, there is a “second Lineage” constituted by powerful Nobility priests, persons who’ve made distinguished contributions to the nation (knights, famed artists, etc...), and those who have paid heavy financial contributions to the crown. The second Lineage is not branded beneath their eyes, are considered a lower political class than direct Lineage, and have only a fraction of the benefits of the Lineage’s noble status.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

entries.name: Goals
entries: After the fall of the Zeméri empire during the Great Gate Wars, six out of the elven Lineage families found their territories now placed in Karaj and Seneka. The divide led to an “Agreement between Kings”, where these families could keep their titles and loyalty to the Zeméri king, along with their usual taxes, but must pay a new hefty tax to the respective rulers of their lands.

The new arrangement has instilled growing animosity between the crowns and the elven nobles. Quietly, the Lineage families use their resources to gather enough power to change the terms of Agreement between Kings, whether through diplomacy or by force.

entries.name: Relationships
entries: The Lineage relies on their relationship and trade between the three nations to maintain their power while the financial strain of their dual taxes weighs on them. For the most part, with help from the Synagogue, they have succeeded.

As their loyalty wanes toward the royal families, the Lineage works in secret against the interest of the crowns. These attacks grow bolder every day and unless substantial changes are made, rumors abound that it is only a matter of time before things turn violent.

entries.name: Lineage Families
entries: The Eleven Lineage families take their names from plants significant to elven culture. These names have changed over the years, most recently after the fall of the empire, but their status in the Lineage has not.
Today, families with territories in Zemer are named after flowers, those in Karaj are trees, and the lone Seneka family, Athulas, shares its name with a most famous herb.

entries.description: Named after a white bell-like flower grown on graves, the family descends from famed knights and politicians. Their Lineage Mother serves publicly as a Dragon’s Heir of the Synagogue.
Sharing the name with “King’s Foil”, a healing herb, the Seneka ambassador's family is gluttonous and over-eager. Their wealth depends on both vast casinos and ethically questionable banks.
A yellow-blossom tree, this Karaji family’s debt is forever growing. They are rumors that the pirate that plagues their naval trade routes are part of a coordinated attack on their family.
Gold star-shaped flowers, Elanor is head by the Crown Chamberlian, providing the family with more direct access to King Jared than any other family.
Fragrant summer trees, the Lairelossë is a pillar of education running the only three universities across the southern nations.
A fragrant flower known to ease the heart, their wealth stems from the construction and repair of temples and fortresses.
Small white flowers also known as “Snow drops”, led by another of the Synagogue’s Dragon’s Heir, is can trace its noble roots further than any other. They are not afraid to show their pride.

: A glossy leaf tree with large fragrant flowers, with two powerful members, a Master of Blood for the Synagogue and a general of the Zeméri army, Oiolaire is untouchable. Their enemies find themselves flayed, drowned and strung across the sides of their warships.

Blood-red flowers, the Seregon family keeps a low profile. While there are rumors of unsanctioned experimentation on the Lesser Races, from forced vampiric infections to illegal genetic manipulation using ancient tech, there is no proof that such accusations are founded.
A uniquely mysterious tree that has been long extinct, the Karaji family is notorious for their political and military push on southern wild folk, driving the remaining tribes north.

A scarlet-fruit tree, the Ambassador of Karaj has no time for folly. Their Lineage Mother demands complete formality to everyone under her banner and places great emphasis on family duty over all else.

name: Prideborn Clans
entries: Unlike their Lynxborn breathren, physicality helped Prideborn overcome the long supremacy of the elves after the empire’s fall. Over centuries, they established powerful noble houses, called Clans, which came to full power during the reign of the Zeméri empire.

Currently, eight noble houses head the furborn families in Zemer with power and influence reaching across the southern nations, and even Egress. These clans maintain long-held ties to the Synagogue and influence politics, industry, art, entertainment, religion, and every other aspect of Zeméri life. Only the strength of the crown and the competing elven Lineage that keeps the Clan’s power in check.

Clan estates comprise of whole villages, needed to support the family’s commerce, and sometimes double as fortresses for the Synagogue’s most powerful members. Despite the sometimes conflict of interest, the Clans remain pledged to King Jared.

A Clan’s most sacred possession is its Yori, or Soulbrand, a set of legendary weapons and armor unique to the Clan. They are powerful tools hand-crafted from Amithrisil (star elves) artifacts using secret techniques. Each Soulbrand is engraved with markings of their clan’s history and ancestral achievements. Theft of even a single Soulbrand by another group or nation would undoubtably mean war, not only with the rest of the Clans, but the full might of the Synagogue as well. Only Zemer’s ruler (as punishment for high crimes against the crown) can rightfully destroy a Soulbrand. The ritual to do so is long and complex, but a Soulbrand’s destruction strips the family (and its branches) of all noble titles, forever branding them as outcasts. In the last 500 years, only one family has seen its Soulbrand destroyed.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

name: Red Horde
entries: The Red Horde rules Uruban's mountainous wastelands uniting hundreds of Uru communities under a single black banner. As a theological hegemony, the Horde is the head religious and political body within the region. Under the guidance of its Night Blood priests, they have established a culture and religion based solely on the worship and reverence of Udreth-sol, Seraph of death and the afterlife.

The Horde operates from Uruban's monastery capital at the heart of the empire, Shalath. Here the First Prophet along with his First Council (including the Ministers of the Masses, Minister of Works, and the Minister of War) rule as the final political and religious authority in Uruban. Serving as the final judgement, their decisions are guided by Tsin-sol's 'Validation', an Arcanum-Uru document which serves as both the Red Horde's Supreme Law and Holy Bible.

Outside of Shalath, five Prophets and their council rule over the lesser monasteries of Udreth-sol. Each temple is charged with protecting a Labyrinth sanctum, the subterranean prison for Uruban's undead and one of the Six Promises (holy relics of the first emperor).

Every 10th Bloody Sun, the Prophets must complete a Trial of Ascension, where they are sent down into the Labyrinth and must find their way back to the surface unharmed, a sign that the Prophet remains in good standing with Udreth-sol. Secretly, the Ascension is steeped with political bribes, blackmail, and the use of necromancy to ensure the power remains within the powerful.

Citizens of the Red Horde live in strict religious, warrior, and worker castes. At the top of the hierarchal pyramid are Night Blood priests who serve as the de facto heads of church and state. Beneath them serve non-Night Blood priests charged with maintaining both temples and the daily lives of their citizens.

Next, the warrior caste is the foundation of the Red Horde's constantly growing war-machine. Led by their Imperial Commandment (the highest-ranking officer), the Horde's military is divided between its army and its 'Death born', a special force made up of powerful priests, paladins, and necromancers.

Lastly, the working caste includes everyone from merchants to tradesmen to guild craftsman. Every member of the Horde is employed to fulfill a service within the community. Service for salvation is the main motivation for the entire population, under threat of imprisonment, banishment, and death.

Personal vendettas are not tolerated by the horde, though many past conflicts are secretly driven by them. While promoting collective salvation and civic duty, the Horde’s working caste has absolutely no political representation and relies on their priests to fulfill their basic needs and yet are expected to conform to the theocratic rule of law of their homeland.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

entries.name: Goals
entries: Despite its vast power, there are still many communities throughout Uruban that have rejected the Horde's call for unity, fearing an erasure of local faiths and traditions. This is unacceptable to the Prophets who have spent years waging a campaign of complete dominance. Tribes and communities that reject the faith are eventually taken by force.

Those that pledge their allegiance to the prophets exchange their freedoms for the protection and salvation of the Horde. Forced to suddenly live a new way of life, eventually the tribe's unique culture and history is inevitably erased. This provides the Horde with new skills and resources to be exploited as their empire continues to grow, without the threat of rebellion.

entries.name: Relationships
entries: There have been many failed invasions into Uruban over the centuries. Even the elves found it impracticable to bring the harsh wastelands, and even harsher Stoneborn, to heel. Conquerors like Leos have long dreamed of a united north under their rule, but no army has yet succeeded in crossing its ranges, let alone lay siege to its capital.

At the same time, without a standing navy nor the resources to send their armies internationally, the Horde's power remains contained within Uruban's borders. Internally, conflicts between the Prophets are unheard of and any occasional uprising resisting the Horde are easily quelled.

description: Asantis is a wise and respected leader surviving three Ascensions. His cunning has brought dozens of communities into the Horde without the need for violence. Having long overseen the steady growth of his people, Asantis has recently turned his eye toward the city of Massanon, “the Eighth Sin.”

As the only elven city to be successfully constructed in Uruban, Massanon is believed to be inhabited by ancient dark elves who survived the destruction of the Elven Empire by making pacts with fiends. Asantis sees the elimination of Massanon's demon possessed as his destined path towards salvation.

entries.name: Felara Brerayne, Prophet of the Masses

description: One of the most recognized Council members among the people, Felara's duties only require that she meet their basic needs of the Horde, providing enough that her people can successfully serve in kind. But Felara has spent her political life trying to bring the technological advancements that southern Meridian enjoys to Uruban.

These include civil technologies like steam powered showers and year-round irrigation. While she has only delivered on a handful of these promises, she already enjoys both the love and respect of the Horde and the wealth that comes with it.
Elynea is a no-nonsense administrator helming all efforts to maintain the Horde's monasteries and religious traditions while simultaneously expanding economic and cultural growth.

This requires a deft hand that no other Councilman can provide. Whether its excavating Stoneborn ruins for important pre-elven relics, preparing country-wide holy day festivals, enforcing the country's borders, or sending soldiers to track and capture rare creatures to expand international trade, Elynea ingeniously oversees countless echelons of government heads single-handedly.

entries.description: The Prophet of War is every bit of the scrutinous hard ass that his soldiers rumor him to be. As the direct line of communication between the First Prophet and the Imperial Commandment, he is responsible for ensuring that all military operations fall in line with the Red Horde's faith. Guldris is ambitious and has spent his life cultivating as many connections as possible throughout the Horde, trading favors to ensure he gets whatever he desires.

name: Synagogue
entries: The Synagogue is a family first, a religious body second and a criminal organization last. Widely known to already be the most powerful of Meridian churches, the Synagogue's goals are varied - but their main objective is incredibly simple - obtain positions of power across every nation of Meridian. They are highly ritualistic, abide a strict code of conduct and chain of command. The Synagogue is divided into cells, also known as Nests, each in control of rigid territorial borders acting autonomously from the rest. Every Nest is led by an elected individual known as the Dragon's Heir.

The Synagogue follows a creed unchanged from their original roots, rebuild the world for Miira’s eventual return, though their methods have definitely evolved. A member of the Synagogue feels that they are a member of a very large family and relies on their brothers and sisters for resources and security. However, members are also granted autonomy to pursue their own interests and gain some measure of personal power or influence when no other orders are present.

On top of being regarded as the wealthiest and most sophisticated criminal organizations, the Synagogue is also a well-respected branch of the human religion. They are Meridian’s largest charitable body, providing disaster relief, healing services and refugee protection during war and other catastrophes. They also have strong ties to local communities, providing financial and protective services, in exchange for respect (and fear). Because of their redeeming qualities, many of its members see their income (and hustles) as a legitimate tax in return for their honorable services.

Much of the Synagogue's money is old money. The faction was established long ago and now its highest members are also some of the wealthiest and most notable families in the southern nations. They maintain their wealth through a combination of legitimate businesses (realty, investments, banking) that they finance but are run by non-members, as well as their illegal activities.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

name: Scarbacks
entries: Demon hunters pledge to Sen-shi.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

name: Exclusionists
entries: Believe in Miira without the Seraphs.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

name: Church of Nobility
entries: The Church of Nobility is an atheist religious institution that follows many of the original teachings of the elves. It has strong ties to the Ephemeron and is made up of countless temples and cathedrals across Meridian, the largest being among nations south of Egress. Many of its members pride themselves in find scientific solutions over magical ones, since science is a gift to the masses while magic is only obtainable by the chosen few.

The Church is led by priests known as “Priors” who are expected to teach and guide followers into making decisions that best lead their flock towards enlightenment, a point where they will ascend the material plane and join the Elven Lords in a higher existence. The Elven Lords are pre-Meridian ancestors who found immortality through ascension, and it is believed that any living creature can do the same (though it never been witnessed in recorded history).

With hundreds of Elven Lords recorded in their holy texts, Priors memorize and share the many paths towards enlightenment. Because these fables often involve powerful, fantastical technology that no living person could possibly have access to, Priors are tasked with deciphering the stories into metaphors and answers to life’s most troubling questions.

Due to the simplicity of its teachings, the ease its followers can become priors themselves, and the immeasurable wealth of the Ephemeron: The Church’s influence vastly overshadows Meridians other religions.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

name: Ash'a
entries: Priests of god-Queen Aurora.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

name: Watchers of the Wild
entries: Larimar's most devoted priests dedicate their lives to the protection of wild magic. Through divination or prophecy, Watchers seek out conduits of wild magic and attempt to bring order where there is none. They believe places of power are holy sites that deserve reverence and that those infused with such power are touched by destiny. Yet, wild magic is difficult to contain and even harder to anticipate and sometimes the most a Watcher can hope for is letting its destruction run its course.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

name: Ephemeron
entries: The Ephemeron Academy of Elven Technology, better known as the Ephemeron (Eff-ehm-err-in), is an Egressian institution that pioneers the reclamation of lost/forgotten elven technology with the ultimate goal of resurrecting the advanced science of ancient elves. It is a professional and academic organization, located throughout southern Meridian (nations south of Egress).

Established during the early days of the Zemeri Empire in the Egressian capital, Amenmaatra, by then-Sergeant-in-arms Iric Cimeros, the Ephemeron was the world’s military research institute. Today, the Ephemeron is politically neutral and provides its services publicly to both world leaders and common masses alike.

Along with its public services, its international charter specifies that the Ephemeron is responsible for building detailed lists of known elven technology, both ancient and modern. They provide states with the names, residencies, and political status of their proprietors. Yet, the Ephemeron itself does not include a policing body and cannot themselves enforce these laws.

The Ephemeron is funded through private and government contracts to explore newly discovered ruins, along with the sale of common modern technology, and fees for training talented artificers in advance study. As a research institution, the Ephemeron also serves as a museum of sorts. The College of Arbitration in Amenmaatra stores and protects relics, especially those found to be potentially dangerous, from the general public.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

entries.name: Goals
entries: Rediscovering the technology of the ancient elves is as much a scientific pursuit as it is a religious one. According to followers of the Nobility, without proving their worth, the Fathomless will come to Meridian bringing about the apocalypse. While non-believers are often skeptical of this ancient threat, others believe that through human-elven cooperation, there will finally be peace across Meridian.

entries.name: Relationships
entries: The Ephemeron’s grasp on elven technology and its mission to protect and preserve bring the organization in regular conflict with other factions. Settlements built around elven ruins quickly strip and sell the structures for parts, destroying any chance the Ephemeron might have had to further their studies.

While the churches of Miira are a constant rival for Meridian’s faithful, it is the Ash’a worshippers that are the Ephemeron’s biggest threat. With the god-Queen Aurora’s declaration that elven technology is Meridian’s great evil, tensions have risen towards a breaking point between the two factions. Only the Ephemeron’s current Conservator, Heleran Lorren, and his collective influence with southern governments keep Aurora’s faithful from initiating open conflict.

entries.name: Figures of Interest
entries: These figures are major members of the Ephemeron.

entries.description: A famed explorer, Heleran departed his already distinguished post at the College to explore the many unmapped parts of Meridian. In his later years, Master Heleran is dedicated to the absolute preservation of all elven ruins across Meridian. While his influence has swayed many southern rulers, he has yet to find common ground between King Leos nor the god-Queen Aurora.

Zealous in their career path, Thurl is serious about his position in the Ephemeron. Thurl encourages local enforcement (guard captain, crown soldiers, etc...) to enforce local laws regarding elven ruins and artifacts. While the Conservator frowns on violent solutions, Thurl will call upon sell swords or adventurers to settle matters when the need arises.

Internal disputes between lower leaders of the Ephemeron area settled by proctors stationed through Meridian. It is Gale’s responsibility to ensure that all proctors adjudicate the Ephemeron’s bylaws fairly and honestly. The most severe disputes or punishments are brought to trial before the Second Proctor who determines a final ruling between both parties. Gale is responsible for reviewing all cases before the Second Proctor and can overturn rulings as he deems necessary.

While on the field, Gale’s son has none of his father’s famed restraint. His duties require Emrick to travel between colleges and outposts throughout Meridian, reviewing the reports of every official. When angered, Emrik acts on impulse, trusting his gut in dealing with task set before him. This has led to multiple controversies over the years, publicly embarrassing both his father and the Curator. Conversely, Emrick is regarded as a fair and well-deliberated judge. In the last 10 years that he has held the position, no ruling has ever been questioned or overturned by the First Proctor.

Selynia maintains detailed records of every elven relic ever recovered and delivered into the Ephemeron’s vaults. Overseeing an army of researchers, scientists, artificers and diviners, Selynia is deeply proud of her work and the respect she's earned among her all-male peers. Calm, quiet and curious, she is determined to add diversity into the Ephemeron’s hierarchy that she believes is too chained to its now ancient traditions.

While the Ephemeron does not have a policing force to deal with lawbreakers outside its walls, it does have soldiers ready to take up arms against the Ephemeron’s enemies. Nirian is the head commander of the Guardians, responsible for protecting their identities from even their peers. Guardians are trained to maintain mundane positions beside lower ranking officials to protect both the guardians and the secrets they possess – especially the location of Ephemeron’s legendary armory.

Nearing 185 years old, Zaltarish is by all accounts the oldest moon elf alive. Despite his slowly failing faculties, he still commands universal respect among the Ephemeron. He is tasked with being the face of the Conservator and his meritocracy. Recently, more and more miscommunications are arising between the missives sent and the messages delivered, though Zaltarish refuses to accept the blame.

name: The Puzzles
entries: Two hundred years ago, the Puzzles were an important competitor to the Ephemeron and an indispensable branch of the Zemeri Council of Ministers. One of Zemer’s best kept secrets, the Puzzles used their affluence to promote the advancement of scientific research while at the same time impeded competing nation’s advancement. But after the ascension of King Jared Kirill, funding has slowly been stripped away from the elven sciences into military advances, specifically the king’s new Marksmen Legion.

With the slow economic drain on the organization, the Puzzles have had to evolve with the times. While still maintaining King Jared’s ear when it comes to new, important discoveries. The Puzzles are now a self-funded, self-governed exploratory faction. With less than fifty members, the Puzzles pride themselves as honored members of the King’s inner circle, allowing only qualified individuals entry through an extensive election process.

Their headquarters, the Winged Palace in Alboran serves primarily as a lodge for its members to discuss guild business, future expeditions, and informal dinner debates on current scientific issues and ideas. While society’s workshop continues to research and develop elven technologies for the crown, the Ephemeron’s international charter allows it to step in and recover any and all discoveries.

Instead, the society’s true power lies within their vaults. Over the course of its existence, the Puzzle’s vaults have collected over two million documents, maps, artifacts, paintings, periodicals, artefacts and books, and that span 500 years of geography, travel and exploration relating to the elves of old, their evolution of their society and their culture. With the power to make or break noble lines through historical records, members of the Ephemeron remain a political figure not worth underestimating.

The Puzzle Society was founded after the uncovering of an imperial age journal and lockbox known as the Ibin’jurati or the 'Madman's Puzzlebox'. The journal’s riddle (both a poetic and mathematical challenge) is considered one of the greatest discoveries of the modern age and has proven notoriously challenging. More than a few have been driven insane with obsession over a solution. Making matters more frustrating is that the question seems to alter itself depending on the person it is directed to.

entries.title:

name: Eastern Fragment
entries: Secret organization within the Ephemeron that smuggles elven technology for nepharious purposes.

name: Zyrese Knights
entries: Warrior-priests similar to the madji.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.

name: Marksmen Authority
entries: Created by imperial moon elves, the authority is a living construct. Since the loss of the empire, the authority has continued its manufacture of Marksmen warriors through the hunting and cannibalizing of Unmarked.

entries.title:
EXAMPLE: Crest of the Arcana Pansophical
Art Credit: {@link Conceptopolis, LLC|http://conceptopolis.com/}
entries.altText: EXAMPLE: A golden rhombus with a blue eye in its center atop an oblong blue and purple magical holy symbol.
